title: For Israel, Hamas and Trump’s Peace Plan, Now Comes the Hard Part
summary: Hamas released hostages and agreed to abide by a cease-fire, but persuading it to lay down its arms is another matter.

title: Israel Identifies 2 Bodies Handed Over by Hamas
summary: The return of the remains of four former captives has spurred anger that more were not retrieved. The devastation to Gaza is likely to make the task especially hard.

title: Trump Takes a Victory Lap, but Avoids Questions About What’s Next
summary: Except for brief references, President Trump did not talk about what it would take to rebuild Gaza or about the future of the Palestinian people.

title: Cheering Crowds Greet Palestinian Prisoners Freed by Israel
summary: “We were happy for our prisoners — and for the Israelis, too,” one Gaza resident said. “We love peace and the truce.”

title: What’s Next for Gaza, and an Ultimatum for Pentagon Reporters
summary: Plus, France versus fast fashion.

title: Trump Enacts Tariffs on Imported Lumber and Furniture
summary: The new taxes went into effect on Tuesday as President Trump also threatened to widen his trade war with China.

title: Trump’s Two Minds on China Sow a Chaotic Few Days
summary: The president’s bellicose vow of steep new tariffs, followed quickly by a more conciliatory message, pointed to an internal tug of war over his approach.

title: U.S. Starts Charging Chinese Ships to Dock at Its Ports
summary: The measure is aimed at countering China’s dominance of commercial shipbuilding and helping to revitalize the American industry.

title: Slowing Electric Vehicle Sales Will Cost G.M. $1.6 Billion
summary: General Motors said it would lower its earnings by that amount to mainly reflect the drop in the value of equipment, factories and other assets.

title: Inside the Improbable, Audacious and (So Far) Unstoppable Rise of Zohran Mamdani
summary: The story of the man most likely to be the next mayor of New York City — and the promise and peril his ascent poses for the Democratic Party.

title: Five Takeaways From the Magazine’s Profile of Zohran Mamdani
summary: How the Democratic nominee for mayor who has stunned the New York establishment is working to shore up support and sustain his momentum.

title: Letitia James and Zohran Mamdani Unite to Fight Trump
summary: Ms. James, in her first public appearance since her federal indictment, said that she and Mr. Mamdani knew what it was like to be threatened and harassed.

title: Will the Supreme Court Use a Louisiana Case to Gut the Voting Rights Act?
summary: The justices have shown a willingness to chip away at the landmark civil rights legislation. A Louisiana case could unravel much of its remaining power.

title: Gov. Janet Mills of Maine to Run for Senate, Aiming at Senator Susan Collins
summary: A two-term Democratic governor, Ms. Mills called herself “battle tested” in an interview. But she faces a Democratic primary before she can challenge the Republican incumbent.

title: North Carolina Republicans Plan to Redraw Congressional Map to Add a Seat
summary: The Trump administration has pushed Republican leaders to redraw House district maps before the midterm elections next year. His party already holds 10 of North Carolina’s 14 congressional seats.

title: This Buzzy New Restaurant Is No Four Horsemen — but It Could Be
summary: I Cavallini is as hard to get into as its Williamsburg precursor, but its Italian cooking is a tad more tentative.

title: Ukraine’s Formula for Peace: Fewer Talks, More Weapons
summary: As Russia rebuffs President Trump’s diplomatic push, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine plans to head again to the White House, this time seeking missiles.

title: Instagram Will Limit Content for Teenagers Based on PG-13 Ratings
summary: The restrictions also apply to conversations between teenage users and artificial intelligence chatbots.

title: Diane Keaton Defied Beauty Standards
summary: For many of her fans, she was like a rare bird soaring from bygone days when progress and growing freedoms for women seemed inevitable.

title: Opioid Deaths Suddenly Dominate a Governor’s Race. Here’s What We Know.
summary: Representative Mikie Sherrill, a New Jersey Democrat, said a firm once owned by her Republican opponent, Jack Ciattarelli, spread misinformation about opioids. His campaign has threatened to sue her for defamation.

title: For Uniqlo’s Founder, Conquering America Is Personal
summary: Tadashi Yanai champions the U.S. market as vital for Uniqlo’s growth, but remains deeply concerned about rising American protectionism.

title: Pete Buttigieg on Rebuilding America After Trump
summary: The former transportation secretary argues Americans need a new sense of belonging.

title: She Struggled With Addiction, Then Tried a Weight Loss Drug
summary: Is a powerful addiction treatment already invented?

title: Meet Zohran Mamdani, the Favorite to Lead New York City
summary: Our reporters explore his skyrocket, his life and his appeal.

title: Late Night Tips the Hat to Trump for Middle East Cease-fire
summary: Jimmy Kimmel celebrated that President Trump “finally did something positive” with his role in the deal between Israel and Hamas.

title: California Forecast: Early-Season Storm Brings a Deluge of Rain
summary: The rare October storm could cause mudslides and debris flow, forecasters said. Some residents in Los Angeles County have been told to evacuate.

title: As U.S. Warships Patrol Caribbean, Drug Smugglers Shift Tactics
summary: With the United States surging its military presence in the region and bombing boats, countries in the Caribbean are seeing more flights carrying illegal drugs.

title: Alfa-Betty Olsen, Behind-the-Scenes ‘Comic Conspirator,’ Dies at 88
summary: After quietly helping Mel Brooks set the irreverent tone on “Get Smart” and “The Producers,” she had a long collaboration as a writer with the actor and humorist Marshall Efron.
